title._content: H. E. Gonsuke Hayashi. Japanese minister Seoul

description._content: Collection: Willard Dickerman Straight and Early U.S.-Korea Diplomatic Relations, Cornell University Library Title: H. E. Gonsuke Hayashi. Japanese minister Seoul Date: ca. 1905 Place: Asia: South Korea; Seoul Type: Portraits Description: Gonsuke Hayashi, 1861 - 1939. Served in the Japanese Foreign Ministry in a number of diplomatic and consular posts in China, Great Britain, Korea, Italy [and perhaps others]. In April 1899 he was appointed Minister in Korea. Hayashi signed various bi-lateral treaties and agreements relating to the status of Korea as a Japanese Protectorate. Most notable was the eJapan-Korea Protocole of February 1904, and the eConvention Providing for Control of Korean Foreign Relations by Japane in November 1905. Inscription/Marks: Inscribed in pencil on verso: 'H. E. Sonsuke Hayashi. Japanese minister Seoul' Identifier: 1260.64.19.03 Persistent URI: http://hdl.handle.net/1813.001/5xqp There are no known U.S. copyright restrictions on this image. The digital file is owned by the Cornell University Library which is making it freely available with the request that, when possible, the Library be credited as its source. We had some help with the geocoding from Web Services by Yahoo!
